properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 4 at 9:55AM EST until January 7 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Southwest
Lower Michigan...

Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County
Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County
Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County

.The crest on the Grand River is approaching Eastmanville
and will be near Robinson Township late today. The drop in water
levels behind the crest will be very slow, and minor flooding will
continue through the weekend. No significant rain or snow is expected
over the next several days which will allow the rivers to continue
falling through next week.  The following forecast is based on
observed and forecast 48 hour precipitation.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Grand River near Comstock Park.
* until late Monday night.
* at  9:09 AM Saturday the stage was 13.1 feet.
* Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
* Minor Flooding is occurring and Minor Flooding is forecast.
* Forecast, the river will continue to fall below flood stage by
Monday morning.
* Impact, at 13.0 feet...Abrigador Trail is underwater and minor
flooding of homes occurs along Abrigador Trail and Willow Drive.
* Flood history, this crest compares to a previous crest of 12.8 feet
on Mar 20 2014.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...Motorists should not attempt to drive around
barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.

Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local
radio... television... or NOAA Weather Radio station for further
information.

Additional weather and river information can be found on our homepage
at www.weather.gov/grr
